title: Anthony Elanga humiliates Man Utd with wonder goal to boost Forest’s Champions League dreams
author: Unknown
summary: Anthony Elanga scored a stunning solo goal against his former club, Manchester United, to secure a victory for Nottingham Forest. This goal highlighted United's ongoing struggles in the Premier League, where they now sit 13th on the table. Despite dominating possession and shots, United couldn't find an equalizer, thanks to Forest's resilient defense led by Ryan Yates and Murillo. Elanga's goal, reminiscent of feats by legends like Ryan Giggs, underscored Forest's promising form under manager Nuno Espirito Santo, pushing them closer to a Champions League spot.
quote: "He’s a special boy [Elanga] and his speed and control of the ball, he just does things by himself."

title: LA Galaxy, Tigres UANL play to 0-0 draw in 1st leg of their CONCACAF Champions Cup quarterfinal
author: Unknown
summary: LA Galaxy and Tigres UANL played to a 0-0 draw in the first leg of their CONCACAF Champions Cup quarterfinal in Carson, California. Both teams struggled offensively under cold and windy conditions. Galaxy goalkeeper John McCarthy and Tigres' Nahuel Guzmán made multiple saves to maintain the draw. The second leg will be held at Tigres' Estadio Universitario in Monterrey, Mexico.
quote: We tried with good opportunities, but in the last third, the last pass, the last assist wasn't there. Then if we don't have that we cannot score goals.

title: Alexander-Walker hits 2 free throws, Wolves weather 61-point night by Jokic in 140-139 win in 2 OTs
author: Unknown
summary: Nickeil Alexander-Walker hit two of three free throws with 0.1 seconds remaining, allowing the Minnesota Timberwolves to overcome a career-best 61-point performance from Nikola Jokic and win 140-139 in double overtime against the Denver Nuggets.
quote: Jokic's 61 points were the most by a player in the NBA this season. He also had 10 rebounds and 10 assists as he played 52 minutes, 38 seconds.

title: Cutter Gauthier scores 2 goals to lead Ducks past short-handed Oilers 3-2
author: Unknown
summary: Cutter Gauthier scored two goals in the second period and Lukas Dostal made a season-high 47 saves, leading the Anaheim Ducks to a 3-2 victory over the Edmonton Oilers. Despite missing key players due to injuries, the Oilers could not clinch a playoff berth. Mason McTavish also scored for the Ducks.
quote: Gauthier tied it early in the second with a one-timer off a pass from Leo Carlsson. The rookie scored again five minutes later, driving the net and roofing a backhand for his third multi-goal game.

title: Klapka, Frost help Flames rally in third period to beat Sharks 3-2
author: AP
summary: Adam Klapka and Morgan Frost scored to lead the Calgary Flames to a comeback victory against the San Jose Sharks with a 3-2 win. The Flames managed to secure the win with three goals in the third period.
quote: Wolf made two saves on two quick shots from Celebrini in the second period that kept the Sharks from adding to their 1-0 lead. The second save was with Wolf sprawled out on the ice.

title: Utah faces Portland, looks to stop 9-game skid
author: The Associated Press
summary: The Utah Jazz, currently on a nine-game losing streak, are set to face the Portland Trail Blazers. Walker Kessler and Collin Sexton are notable performers for the Jazz, while Anfernee Simons and Deni Avdija are top performers for the Trail Blazers. Injuries for both teams could play a significant role in the outcome of the game.
quote: Utah looks to end its nine-game skid when the Jazz play Portland.
figures: The Jazz are 2-11 against Northwest Division teams.
The Trail Blazers have an 18-35 record against teams over .500.
Walker Kessler averaging 11.1 points, 12.2 rebounds, 2.4 blocks.
Anfernee Simons averaging 19.3 points and 4.8 assists.
